alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 02 at 9:00PM AKST until February 04 at 5:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THURSDAY TO 5 AM AKST FRIDAY THROUGH THOMPSON PASS... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Thompson Pass. * WHEN...From 10 AM Thursday to 5 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility to one quarter mile.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
